file_content.text: Yes! After three hundred years, we finally get what's ours!
It's ours, I tell you! It's always been ours!
Brass called me when you left. Wanted to see if your work's as good as your rep.
Is there something else you want me to do?
Why? Is there another job?
Well, I doubt he's asking you over for a cup of mudleaf tea.
Captain Childress calls, it usually means something needs fixing.
You better believe it.
Captain Childress is going to love that attitude.
He's got something for you to do, and he said to pass the word.
If you're interested, go look him up. His office is at HQ, other side of the base. Tell them you're the one who ran off the brat brigade.
No time to chat. I'm on my way to bigger and better.
I'm outta here.
Must be nice, getting to just pick up and go like that.
Anyway, if you get a yen to serve the Republic again, look for Captain Childress. He's usually at HQ, other side of the base.
Excellent job! We could smell the smoking metal corpses from here--
I told him that's not really possible--
So, who are the crooks who set themselves up on our property? Did you drive them off?
They say they've got claim to the land, too.
Some aliens with a sob story.
Nonsense! The Republic approved us. I'm not wasting time on some fortune hunters.
It's been three hundred years. Maybe we should talk to them....
Forget it. It's ours. Ours at last.
They're gone.
Thank you. Please take this for your services.
Don't forget our deal.
Of course.
Thank you for your help. I think the Republic would have made us wait another three hundred years.
I can't wait to see it for myself. I know it's not what it used to be, but maybe we can make it beautiful again....
Hey, good job. Both on the droids and getting those two off our necks.
I took out the droids, but it won't be safe to live there.
You shouldn't settle there.
What are you talking about?
Is it the rakghouls, monsters...? I told you we should have waited until the planet was opened to settlers.
It's been three hundred years. Give up on Taris and start over.
You need to go home.
The land is held by the alien who owns this deed. Her claim is better than yours.
Not monsters. The real owners.
Just forget it.
No! I am not just going to give up like this!
We've got no choice, Relus. We can't do this on our own.
Your ancestors stole this land. I have the real deed right here.
You're the crooks.
Look at these papers. The aliens there have as good a claim as yours.
You need to share.
The "alien resettlement" was a valid executive order approved by the Republic. This is our land!
There are alien survivors who kept their claim? I'd have thought they would never want to come back here. I--I studied the history. It wasn't right.
It was justified! You can't make us leave because of that.
It'll take more than two people to turn this place civilized.
You should work together.
I agree, Relus. This isn't our ancestors' estate.
This is a frontier. We'll need to grow food, sew clothes, defend ourselves. Wouldn't it be better to ally with these aliens?
Sew clothes? Hmm... maybe we should just hear them out, see what they're looking for.
We won't turn them away. I know what it's like to want a home.
Afraid I can.
You can't do this to us! Our family governed this planet. We owned it!
It's been a long time since that mattered, Relus.
You couldn't face those droids. You don't want to face me.
Leave before I get mad.
Are you threatening me?
Yeah--they are. And don't make them follow up on it.
Yes, she is. And don't make her prove she can do it.
Yes, I think he is. And I'm pretty sure we should listen.
We'll be on the next ship out. It was kind of crazy to think we'd get our dream after three hundred years. That only happens in stories.
Hey, good job. Both on the droids and getting to the bottom of that mess. Taris politics, huh, who cares about this dump anyway?
Destroy the blasted droids, and I'll show those claim jumpers a thing or two.
We've been waiting weeks! And those things are still swarming our property while you sorry excuses for defenders of the Republic sun yourself on the base.
This is a military operation, sir. This planet hasn't been cleared for civilian occupancy.
My brother didn't mean to be insulting. But for three centuries, our family has dreamt of reclaiming our place on Taris. And now to be stopped by those things....
It never looks good to see a Republic soldier refusing aid to one of his own.
The lady has a point.
I got orders I got to follow. No civilian claims 'til the place is secure.
Sir! Just following orders, sir.
And it must be nice not having orders to follow. If we chased down every homestead, we wouldn't have the men to hold the base.
Not true, sir! Helping them not get killed--that's aid, right?
I couldn't help overhearing....
Their old estate's off base, so we got no way to secure it.
Taris is our home. We're not going to wait until the army takes its pick of the planet and then throws us the scraps!
Taris is a dangerous place. What are you doing here?
The private is right.
Our ancestors escaped Taris before the bombardment. They kept everything--deeds, papers, we've even got holo-images of the estate. They always intended us to return.
We can't go chasing civilian claims, justified or not. We've barely got the men to hold the base.
The Republic validated our records. But some outlaws set up a camp there--they've got security droids all around the perimeter.
You need something dangerous cleared out first?
Can I help?
It's not rakghouls or anything. There's someone living there. Sentients.
I don't see the problem.
It's too dangerous. Some kind of outlaws set up a camp there.
They've got security droids all around the perimeter. It's a war zone.
This is an argument about three-hundred-year-old real estate?
Isn't there something to kill?
No. This is about a Republic citizen, whose home has been invaded by someone with an army of sec-droids, being ignored by the soldiers who should protect him!
We almost got killed entering our own property!
The Republic will respond to all such claims of hostile non-indigenous life-forms based on strategic value.
After three hundred years, you can't blame someone for thinking it was up for grabs.
Land's been empty a long time.
Each generation has passed down these deeds. We always knew we would return to Taris, that we were merely exiles.
If the Republic won't help us claim it, we're going to have to go back to Alderaan.
Where does their property stand in the expansion plans?
Is the land valuable?
Personal land, sir. It'll be explored once all the public space is secured.
That's what they keep saying. That we can only claim it if we fight those awful droids ourselves. But how?
Unless... could you help us?
It is wrong to risk lives for mere property.
It's only land.
Jedi, I know that you are just kids when you leave to train, but isn't there anywhere that you miss? A place, that you will always feel in your heart, is home?
Is there any way I could move you to help us?
After so long, you should not be kept from your home.
Your ties here are strong.
See! Listen to the Jedi. She knows we're the rightful owners.
See! Listen to the Jedi. He knows we're the rightful owners.
Need a hand?
Yes! Tell this coward we're the rightful owners, and he has to help us.
You want to explore, you look like you can handle it, but it's your choice.
Would you really be willing to take such a risk for us?
Your claim seems just.
I'll do what I can.
Great. They're all yours, then. You find anything important, you can fill out a form at HQ.
All we need is to get those blasted droids cleared out and find out who's controlling them. I can handle the rest.
Not for free.
Our family was fortunate to escape the bombardment with their fortune intact. Help us reclaim what's ours, and you'll be well rewarded.
Of course we'll pay. But no droids. No... whatever's living there. Clear them out, I don't care how.
You heard the man. Take a number.
You can wait. [Refuse quest]
Not my issue. [Refuse quest]
Your generosity boggles the mind.
Don't they know who I am?
